hackathon-description-text: Revolution UC is open to all high school, undergraduate and graduate students, including freshmen! You don't have to attend the University of Cincinnati; you don't have to be a computer science major or even an engineering student, though you should have some coding or engineering experience. You aren't required to have ever attended a hackathon before: we will have tech talks beforehand so you can ramp up quickly. You can come with a team or come alone. We will have sessions to help people find team members and/or form teams, as well as an idea workshops to help people think of ideas to work on for the hackathon.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Professor Computer Science | University of Cincinnati
UC Mobile App Lab | University of Cincinnati

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Up to 4 Nexus 7s and 1 year WolframAlpha Pro and Mathematica and GitHub TShirt
Up to 4 Pebbles and 1 year WolframAlpha Pro and Mathematica and GitHub TShirts
Up to 4 64GB Flash Drive and 1 year WolframAlpha Pro and Mathematica and GitHub TShirts
iPad Mini or Amazon gift cards
Lunch with Dean Lim & 3D-printed models of McMicken
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Project that most improves UC Student Experience

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=University of Cincinnati, University of Cincinnati - Medical College, 2600 Clifton Avenue, Cincinnati, OH 45220, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Would the application have real social impact? Can it change the world, or at least help someone in your community? Does the project have a wow factor?
Is the solution novel? Does it solve a problem in a creative or never-seen-before way?
Did the participant(s) solve a hard technical problem? Did they get a working demo completed within the allotted time?
